function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Spatial analyses based solely on vector data models may limit the understanding of contagious disease spread through other data types such as raster models or network data.","Impact":"Inadequate spatial analyses may result in insufficient or inaccurate insights into the spread of contagious diseases in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Incorporate additional data models, such as raster or network data, to complement vector data models in spatial analyses.","Technologies":"Geospatial software that supports raster and network data analysis.","People":"Researchers, urban planners, and public health officials involved in analyzing contagious disease spread.","Owner":"Research institutions, urban planning agencies, and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Conducting an online survey may lead to a biased sample composition, potentially skewing the data analysis and conclusions.","Impact":"Incorrect conclusions and recommendations based on biased survey data may negatively impact public health interventions and policies related to contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Implement targeted outreach strategies to reach underrepresented age groups and conduct supplementary in-person surveys to validate online responses.","Technologies":"Survey design software for targeted outreach and data validation processes.","People":"Survey administrators, researchers, and policymakers utilizing survey data for public health decision-making.","Owner":"Public health organizations, survey research firms, and research institutions."},{"Description":"Preference for online questionnaires among younger respondents may result in overrepresentation of this age group in the survey data, leading to age bias in the analysis and conclusions.","Impact":"Age bias in the survey data may lead to inaccurate insights into the impact of contagious diseases on different age groups, affecting the efficacy of public health interventions targeted at specific age demographics.","Mitigation":"Employ sampling and weighting techniques to account for age bias and validate the survey findings through supplementary methods.","Technologies":"Statistical software for data weighting and validation processes.","People":"Data analysts, researchers, and policymakers utilizing survey data for public health decision-making.","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions, and statistical analysis firms."}]}
